articles.content:
The Hague A coronavirus variant known as “Mu” may be a cause for concern, said the European Medicines Agency (EMA) on Thursday (Sept 9).

articles.author: Adam Chapman
articles.title: EMA issues 'warning' about new 'serious' side effect of the AstraZeneca Covid vaccine - Express
articles.description: THE EUROPEAN Medicines Agency (EMA) has added a rare but serious condition to its product information for the AstraZeneca Covid vaccine. The regulatory body has issued a warning that a 'causal relationship' to the vaccine is a 'reasonable possibility'.

articles.author: Jon Ihle
articles.title: AIB and EBS fined for miscalculating capital strength - Independent.ie
articles.description: AIB and EBS have been fined by the European Central Bank (ECB) for miscalculating their capital needs over a period of two years.
articles.content:
AIB and EBS have been fined by the European Central Bank (ECB) for miscalculating their capital needs over a period of two years.

articles.title: Citing high shot rates, Danes end COVID-19 restriction - The Washington Post
articles.description: Denmark’s high vaccination rate has enabled the Scandinavian country to become one of the first European Union nations to lift all domestic COVID-19 restrictions
articles.content:
More than 80% of people above the age of 12 have had the two shots.
